intro: Ambaiba albicans, commonly known as the white ambaiba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, white petals that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Ambaiba albicans typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
